header.title: Making the world a happier place, one tshirt at a time
header.copy: Coca-Cola wanted to thank people who make the world a happier place by bringing together 600 of their customers, fans and employees to star in their own movie. We started by printing each frame of the film on 600 separate t-shirts, which were sent to around the globe with a personalized thank you. The recipients were simply asked to put on a smile, take a photo, and claim their frame in a collective effort to complete the film.  We handled everything from creative collaboration, design, and prototyping to front-end and back-end development of the HTML5 website.

projectSubHead: An interactive journey through the magic of Northlandz.

header.title: Explore the world's largest model railroad
header.copy: Northlandz is the world's largest model railroad, built entirely by one man - Bruce Zaccagnino. Sony and Wieden+Kennedy teamed up with us to create a Street View-esque interactive version of Northlandz, built for people around the world to virtually explore Bruce's amazing creation.

projectSubHead: Enjoy a Keurig brew in 3 simple steps.

header.title: Your morning coffee has never been so fun
header.copy: For the release of the Keurig 2.0, we created an online and physical game, inspired by the popular memory game Simon. We then took to the streets of Toronto, launching the game at a two-day event in Dundas Square, where thousands of people gathered to experience The Ultimate Brewhaha Game..

projectSubHead: An interactive bilboard for the holidays.

header.title: Sharing Christmas cracker fun with at Piccadilly Circus
header.copy: On the week before Christmas, McDonald’s spread some Festive cheer in Piccadilly Circus with an interactive digital billboard. For one day only, the billboard showed a giant Christmas Cracker, that passers-by could pull with a swipe of their phone, and win a Winter Warmer or Toffee Latte.

projectSubHead: Three great choices. One amazing way to decide.

header.title: BLURRING THE LINES BETWEEN DIGITAL AND REALITY
header.copy: For the launch of the new Hyundai Elantra models, We teamed up with Innocean LA to create the Driveway Decision Maker experience. To help users choose the right Elantra for them, we created a journey where you can pick one of the new models and watch it drive to your house. By using projection mapping sequence, real-time 3D animations in Google Maps and Street View, we let users park the right car in their own driveway.

header.title: COMET COLLIDER
header.copy: Comet collider is an interactive holographic installation where multiple users can play simultaneously by connecting with their mobile devices. By combining HTML5 websockets we were able to build a simple user interface to create a real-time interactive hologram.

projectSubHead: The only app you'll ever need to survive the zombie apocalypse.

header.title: DESIGN YOUR OWN SURVIVAL MACHINE
header.copy: Young audiences were already familiar with Hyundai. But in order to transform that familiarity into a positive association with the brand, this audience needed a relevant way to engage with the vehicles. For a generation obsessed with zombies, we created The Walking Dead Chop Shop app, allowing users to configure their very own Zombie Survival Machine. The app lets fans build and customize their own zombie survival machine, equipped with flamethrowers, razor wire, machine guns, and many more goodies.

header.title: Lexus Design Disrupted at New York Fashion Week 2013
header.copy: For NYFW 2013, I turned the 2014 Lexus IS into an interactive holographic work of art.  My interactive installation allowed guests to engage with holograms projected inside the car with their mobile devices, creating entrancing animations and stunning graphics. The more people that connected, the more vibrant the holographic visuals became.

projectSubHead: An HTML 5 experiment to celebrate the launch of Bossa.

header.title: Welcome to Bossa!
header.copy: Bossa's inaugural project, a site experiment on Google Chrome, is a clever and delightful journey told through HTML 5, Google Maps API and charming character animation. The design and ad community took note - www.letsbossa.com was honored by the Webby's and as FWA's site of the day.

header.title: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet
header.copy: To introduce the Intel Pocket Avatars to the world, we created an epic karaoke, showcasing the avatars themselves, educating the guests on the app’s functionality while entertaining them at the same time.
